SCO Skunkware 96 GNU Development System

Robert Lipe (robertl@arnet.com) ported the GNU development system and tools to SCO OpenServer 5. Recently he has posted an update of the tools we included on SCO Skunkware 5. This update is available on SCO Skunkware 96 as a tar archive of custom installable media images in scods.954b.tar and as media images that can be installed off of the SCO Skunkware 96 CD in the subdirectory /dist/Tools/gds-95q4/VOLUMES.

The documentation and release notes for this distribution are available in

  • On-line HTML documents
  • /dist/Tools/gds-95q4/95q4-doc-html.tar.gz(HTML format)
  • /dist/Tools/gds-95q4/95q4-doc-ps.tar.gz(Postscript format)
  • /dist/Tools/gds-95q4/95q4-relnotes.tar.gz(Release Notes)

You can read an overview that Robert provided describing what's included in this distribution and how to install it.

You may want to read some brief instructions on how to build dynamically shared libraries with this gcc.

A document describing the patches Robert submitted is also available.

Finally, Robert provides us with a document describing how to build this release.
